overview: In the early decades of cinema, some of the most innovative and celebrated filmmakers in America were women. Alice Guy-Blach√© helped establish the basics of cinematic language, while others boldly continued its development: slapstick queen Mabel Normand (who taught Charlie Chaplin the craft of directing), action star Grace Cunard, and LGBTQ icon Alla Nazimova. Unafraid of controversy, filmmakers such as Lois Weber and Dorothy Davenport Reid tackled explosive issues such as birth control, abortion, and prostitution.
title: Pioneers: First Women Filmmakers
